Stopped in for happy hour while I waited for a friend. The space inside is cozy and dimly lit. Perfect for a date night spot! Happy hour included two cocktails. No wine was included on their happy hour menu which I was disappointed about. I loved the red wine I ordered (sadly I don't remember the name). Carlos was the bartender and he was great! Really accommodating and speedy with his service. I ordered the spinach artichoke dip which was delicious; came out piping hot with half a baguette. Overall, I'd definitely stop back!
Great service! The plates came really quickly and were both delicious. Also the basil drink smells and tastes fantastic! Just though the music were too loud. Besides that, great!
No comment
Everything here was pretty good. I really liked the appetizer. Entrees were okay. Would come back here to try their brunch menu. We had their dinner menu.
We were in a quest for a real croque monsieur and this did not disappoint. Nice food, lovely service and a cool neighborhood vibe. Can't wait to go back!
Great local space, intimate and laid back. The meal was delicious and the staff were attentive. Great for a cozy date night or casual dinner with friends.
Got the steak frites and it wasn't very good. Steak was tough and cold.  The ambiance is nice and the service is good too.

A decent neighborhood bistro with a good selection of wine if you're into that sort of thing. The meal was decent but the duck was a bit tough. If you're craving french food around chinatown, it's not a bad choice. They also have daily specials and live music on certain days.
Great brunch spot with friendly staff and an intimate setting. Can't speak for the cocktails since I didn't have any, but everything else was great.
No comment

30$ brunch deal is what we came in for. Comes with unlimited coffee, a cocktail, and an entree. Split it with my mom (she had the drink and I had the coffee) they dont do any substitutions. Like different cheese on the croissant sandwich. Food was tasty though. Our waitress outfit was pretty skimpy, super short skort-I was surprised. Service was alright. Good but not sure id come back. Id try somewhere else next time

excellent poached eggs & best coffee I've had in a while. This is a hole in the wall gem - limited but solid and very French menu
Great little comfy French bistro on the corner of Henry and Jefferson streets. Warm welcoming service with great drinks and food. I will be back.

All dishes were amazing, outdoor seating is also cute. I got a pear cocktail which was also extremely delicious. The kale salad was really unique, with greek yogurt and orange and anchovies. There's not really vegetarian entrees but it's a special that changes. They made me a risotto with burrata and tomatoes, red onions, and pesto drizzle. It was amazing and a huge portion, so I took the leftovers home put it into an omelette the next morning! Very cute place. Appreciated their duck dish is called "coin coin" which means "quack quack" in French.
Solid place in LES for brunch. Had no trouble finding a table and food was great. Recommend to bring cash.

Nice and cozy French restaurant. Yummy oyster special on Wednesdays ($1.50 each) kale salad was delicious. The steak frites and blue cheese burger (could use more blue cheese) were also quite yummy! Service was great by the gentleman (Colin?)  who also was the host. Drinks were also good especially the Spicy Carrot margarita. I have to come back when there is live music! Solid neighborhood spot! I like that they also give a little salad with the mains, very European and Balanced.
No comment
No comment
Great neighbourhood favourite- good value and friendly staff, good food. Nice to sit at the bar too.
No comment
Mediocre food and service. It always has seats thou so that's convenient for the neighborhood
Good place for brunch, kid friendly. Less crowded sidewalk cafe experience than you get a couple to blocks north. Cash preferred with a surcharge on credit cards.

Went for dinner with friends recently. Food, drinks were amazing. Pricing was also very reasonable. Only thing is service is a little slow but they only had 2 servers for the entire restaurant so understandable. Would recommend the mussels with a side of fries!
We sat in the covered patio on the sidewalk and appreciated the heaters! The food was incredible and the service top notch. Thank you!

Lovely French eatery with great staff. I stopped by for a cocktail on my way to the Van Gogh Experience exhibit. I decided to return for dinner after the expo. The energy in this place is great for dates and intimate friend outings. The lighting is great. I first sat at the bar for drinks. I later sat at a table for dinner. I had the steak frites and my partner had the mussels. I will definitely return - they have daily specials! S/O to Miranda the bartender!
Great atmosphere, music, food. Would definitely return and have referred friends who say the same.
No comment
No comment

I love this place! The indoor vibe is so romantic. For a nice French restaurant the prices are so reasonable for food and alcohol. The staff is very attentive as well. I've tried the oysters, the steak frites, and the mussels. All delicious! Their espresso martini is fabulous as well! Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
Delicious. Great food, quick service, nice staff. Would go again. The foie gras was magic
No comment
This place was amazing. Good service, nice outdoor dining, live music and great food. Definitely coming back.
No comment

Great night at Les enchants de boheme! Will definitely swing by more. They have live music on Thursday and Saturday nights and we just so happened to have a birthday so it made it 100 times better. The food was delicious. I separately came here for brunch in the past and that was yummy as well. Perfect place to go to for a date or for a small group. Shots were passed on the house. There is a cake cutting fee for those that are aap planning to celebrate birthdays here ($7 per person). They additionally accept card for those that are wondering.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a lovely time here. Our waiter was extremely friendly and attentive. Two Bridges cocktail was amazing, 10/10. Ordered the soup of the day which was a squash soup with cream, we gave it a 3/5. It was okay, nothing exciting about the soup.. a bit too watery and lacking in seasoning. For entrees we ordered the duck, which is easily a 10/10. It was cooked to perfection and had amazing flavor. The second entree we ordered was the beef which we gave a 9/10, the only complaint about the beef was that we found it extremely salty, however other than that it was quite delicious. Definitely recommend trying this place out for date night.
No comment
Great food and amazing atmosphere. It's so hard to find a quiet brunch spot in the city. Loved it!
Amazing food, perfect music, lovely service, warm and welcoming atmosphere. The roast is perfectly cooked and accompanied by delicious sides. Lovely spot for an intimate date.

Incredible experience. The lighting, mood, vibe, the music, the food, and team (all around, hands down  team) are all so good. We were welcomed from the start. I had the duck, which was perfectly marbled, and not overwhelming fatty...the first duck I ever loved tbh. Their bartenders mix up amazing gin, whiskey, and mezcal cocktails... Miranda is so welcoming and attentive. 7 out of 5 folks. A must.

Good vibe, great food with very pleasant staff, great music. Stopped in after an event nearby & had a lovely late brunch. Making reservations ahead is a good idea though the wait without one will be worth it, I promise.  The bacon made me swoon & finding a perfect Eggs Benedict made me so very happy. My husband devoured his Croque Monsieur. Go!

column6: The food was pretty good. The mussels were a bit gritty. We asked for medium-rare steak but it was closer to medium/medium-well. We were seated outdoors and it wasn't too busy, but I didn't feel like the waitresses really checked in with us, and never asked how our food was. Outdoor seating had an overall casual and maybe a little dingy feel, the inside looked much nicer though. They have a 3% fee if you use a credit card.

I have been here a few times and each time the experience is personable, warm, friendly and absolutely delicious. Some of my favorites are steak frites, and their signature salad with chicken. Poached eggs always cooked to perfection, and the drinks are always on point... try the espresso martini. All of the staff is warm, attentive, and really adds to the overall experience. The music, ambience, and lighting are always on point. I always return here for both business and leisure. Bon appetit!

The food was very tasty. The physical space is ok. Service is friendly but forgetful. We will return

Great little gem. Good food and service was excellent. Nice for a date.  Had the mussels and Brussel sprouts.

WOW!!  Had an amazing brunch here today and I can't wait to come back.  The location is wonderful.  The staff couldn't be more lovely and the food was amazing!  I can't believe it's taken me this long to discover this place, but I plan on coming back again...and again!
Nice place, pleasant people.  Sadly, slow service, forgot portions of order, didn't disclose in advance credit card premium, no substitutions.    More frustrating than it should've been.
No comment

This was a wonderful experience for my friend's birthday brunch. The staff was accommodating: we were running late and had to move the reservation back 30 mins and there were 11 of us. Not a problem! The interior is very pleasant - everyone commented on the mural on the back wall. Most of the party had some form of Eggs Benedict (with salmon, ham, etc.) I had the Croque Madame, which was absolutely delicious! Two friends ordered mimosas and they were quite strong! Prices were very reasonable for the good amount of food and drinks we ordered. Only gripe is the cash-only policy but their great service and food make up for it. Plus there's an ATM inside!

I think this place is overrated. We came here on a weekday night after seeing the immersive Van Gogh exhibit at Pier 36. We were looking for restaurants nearby, and this restaurant showed up on Yelp, so we decided to give it a try. We got outdoor seating and ordered several drinks (spicy margarita and red wine), two appetizers (tartine and soup; we wanted to order oysters but they were not available), an entree (duck), and a dessert (chocolate mousse). I like the cocktail, but the food was just ok. The duck was not tender, and the potatoes weren't cooked well. Even the sauce wasn't tasty. The service was very slow. I'm not sure if they are understaffed. We waited at least twenty minutes to just get the drinks, and another twenty minutes for appetizers. The whole meal took almost two hours. The server never came to check whether everything was ok. She took away the water bottle on our table but didn't come back with a refilled bottle until we asked her. The only time for the quick service was when we asked for check, and the bill came immediately. They do charge a 3% fee if you are paying with credit card. You can also pay cash. They have an ATM inside the restaurant.
Hands down favorite place to eat great food with the coolest people and the best vibe. So happy they're open again. The LES Enfants experience is consistently fantastic. LOVE. THIS. PLACE. GO!!!!
The outside seating is real cute. The artichoke dip was amazing. The best I ever had! The staff wasn't friendly. Kind of rude, nobody smiled. The menu is difficult, wish they had some pictures.
No comment

Stopped by for an outdoors December brunch. The outdoor dining area was pleasant and fairly comfortable although issues regarding the function of outdoor heaters precluded their use on the date we visited. The food was very good, as has been the case on previous visits. I had a crepe Norvege, a buckwheat crepe filled with salmon and goat cheese and topped with a nice small salad. GF had Eggs Florentine poached eggs with Tuscan kale. Everything was tasty and nicely presented and the service was also good. If they get the outdoor heaters to function, looking forward to brunch outdoors in January or February .
No comment
No comment
We were there for a birthday dinner. The place is magical. The food, the live music, the warm staff. It's become one of our favorite places in town. Check it out.

Last night we had another wonderful night at Les Enfants. The food is always delicious, it has a sophisticated wine selection, the atmosphere has a wonderfully bohemian vibe, the service staff is great. Been coming here for the past few years regularly, with large groups for special events and for a romantic dinner with my man. I can't recommend it enough! (i love the kale salad and the chicken entry, so good)
Great spot with real French crepes and a nice brunch / breakfast menu. Plus the staff is friendly !
No comment
Really beautiful atmosphere with the live band. The food and service were great, too!

First of all, BEST French bread in NYC, hands down. Besides that, this place is a hidden gem. The food is great--the pâté is a MUST have and the braised beef is identical to what my grandmother used to make. Our waitress Aida was so attentive and gave us complementary champagne at the end of our meal, plus extra bread to take home (we were ecstatic). The bartender (whose name has slipped my mind) made fabulous martinis that we had to personally complement him on. My boyfriend got an espresso martini and I got one of their signatures, the filthy husband (basically just a super dirty vodka martini). Both were amazing. If you're looking for great food without the price tag and the typical dimes square crowds...do not miss this place! I cannot say better things.

We went here to celebrate a birthday, sat inside and it was so good! The service was great, the food was FAST and delicious, and the brunch cocktails were yummy! We all had eggs benedict or eggs florentine, and the eggs were cooked perfectly, and everything was fresh and delicious! We will definitely be back

I have to admit, Les Enfants de Boheme was really exceptional. Reasonable rates for this area. Excellent food, Croque Madame was incredible without a doubt. This Croque Madame was prepared just perfectly. Wonderful central location, excellent service. Les Enfants de Boheme - It is a unique and wonderful experience.
No comment
Delicious food! From the wine and cheese to the main course, everything was perfection. Hope to make it back!
No comment

Delicious. Friendly. Small and cozy. A perfect stop for lunch. Burger -the best flavor. And the chocolate martini was a knock out.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon. My boyfriend and I we're lucky, we just got into the restaurant before everyone started to come in. Seats quickly filled up. The decor is very nice. We were seated near the kitchen and for some reason the lights around us was very dim, I wish the lights were a little better so I wouldn't have to struggle to look at the menu. My boyfriend and I ordered the Les egg Norwegian and Les egg Florentine. It came quick. I love that my eggs were runny. Highly recommend this spot for brunch
No comment

It's been almost two years since my last visit, far too long. Friendly service, excellent menu choices including daily specials, great food. The roasted camembert roti followed by steak and frites was magnifique, merci Les Enfants, a bientot.

Came on a Saturday during lunch time. I had the Croque Madame which was excellent and my friend had the Eggs Benedict, which she described as the best eggs benedict she's had in a while. We also had the regular crepe to share which was a bit disappointing. Will definitely be coming back to try other dishes.

woaaaw! what an incredible,scrumptious experience i had at LES ENFANTS DE BOHEME my first time here... what a gem !  pear Botanical ? a must ! mussels? duck,? braised beef? OMFG!!! artichoke dip.... my mouth is watering thinking about my delightful meal... The hostess etna greeted us with such warmth and brought us "bubbles "! best champagne i've ever had ... i met 2 bartenders ... a girl with beautiful nails named ollie and a man in a Sleek vest named collie ! they both told me wonderful stories about Love and Longing and Landscapes and brewed me the amazing cocktails,designed by a wonderful beautiful lady named Mira Margarita. i was able to practice my french with a man named ludo... his bussing skills -- OMG !!!!! he is octopus man ! Jennyviva gave us excellent anecdotes... LOVE IT HERE!!!!!! my new spot!!! what a TREAT!!! merci beaucoup
Great food and atmosphere, professional, friendly service! They welcomed our party of 7 and gave us an enjoyable evening.
No comment
If you know how special the friendly neighborhood bistro is to a Parisian, we'll, that's what Les Enfants is for us. Good food, good company, good times.
The food, drinks, staff, ambience, everything is amazing. Such a lovely and authentic French hidden gem in the LES. 11/10 can't recommend it more

Came here before seeing the Van Gogh exhibit with my mom and boyfriend and it was SUPERB! At first we were a little hesitant because it isn't the most beautiful location, but the food was delicious! The spinach and artichoke dip is a must, their mussels in white was delicious and so was the slow cooked beef. Highly recommend!

Best servers!! Best food !! Best place! Umm HELLO!!! Les Enfants is seriously my sanctuary. Been coming here for years and have only had 10/10 experiences. Besides the magnificent cocktails and mussels, I really come here for the lovely waitresses that always make my time here memorable. Merci queens!! Xx

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: I recently moved to the neighborhood and finally got a chance to check out Les Enfants de Bohème. This place is awesome. The staff are all super friendly and helpful. Miranda suggested that I try the peccarino risotto special they had, after I told them I was a vegetarian looking for suggestions. All I can say is Damn! it was so good. They also helped me pick out a beer. They have a great German pilsner. They had lovley live music and an open and inviting atmosphere.  Everyone on the staff was friendly, helpful and made sure I had everything I needed.  They were pretty busy and they all still took the time to go above and beyond.

A great find!  My friend and I had a pre-Van Gogh dinner here and it was terrific. Food, service and atmosphere were all top-notch. So much so that we chose to go back after the exhibit for an at-the-bar drink only to find that it's also a bit of a neighbourhood hangout - very cool and definitely on the "must go back to" list!

I was in the area for an art gallery opening and happened to stop here for dinner after since it was nearby. Be aware this place is CASH ONLY but they do have an ATM in the back. We got the cucumber salad to share and it was pretty good, but the mussels I had for my entree could have been much better. They were tiny and over cooked with broken shells throughout. Not sure how this place has 4.5 stars. Maybe brunch is better?

intimate french restaurant that's good for small parties or for a date night. food was very delicious. the slow braised beef was tender and the carrots were fresh. the mussels were a large portion but weren't as fresh as i would like them. the duck was extremely good, highly recommend that. overall, good food, good ambience, would come again.

Had a really nice brunch here before seeing the Van Gogh exhibit.  It is a small, casual neighborhood place that definitely is worth a visit if you are nearby.
No comment

Coffee was good (very important).  I kept it basic with two eggs over easy and side of bacon.  The bacon side was amazing in itself.  First, normally a side costs a lot and you get little.  This place got it backwards.  Second and more importantly, it was very tasty.  I couldn't finish it.  The eggs cooked perfect and I enjoyed my meal.  Service was friendly and comfortable.

Magical experience. The food and wine were extraordinary, poetic combinations. The waitresses were a seamless part of the experience; elegant and obliging, they really made our dinner rich. Thanks for the great night!
No comment

Still the same wonderful, classic French food, excellent and tasty cocktails and great service.  And outside to boot!  I know it is a necessity and although I live in the Bronx now I will still try to visit and dine as often as I can with friends.  Maybe they can pitch a tent with some heaters for winter dining al fresco? Worth a trip on the D train from Bedford Park for the food and atmosphere.  I hope you stay forever.
No comment
Really good servers, bartenders, and food at a great price for this neighbor. Very nice neighborhood spot
No comment

Stumbled on this fabulous French find & I just had to write a great review. My husband & I shared a few plates bcs everything sounded so good, we couldn't decide what to have. The foie gras melts in your mouth, the kale salad was dressed with a wonderful yogurt-Ceasar dressing & the salmon was perfectly prepared atop a fresh vegetable salad featuring cucumbers, onions & tomatoes. Lastly, our server, Colin, took great care of us. We'll definitely be back.
Such a great find, cocktails punch well above this small restaurants weight class. Gracious staff, as well as entree-portion tartare.

What a cute place - had a great dinner there last night. The duck confit (breast) was great, the steak was also great, and overall it was a solid meal. My friend had The Two Bridges cocktail which was delicious. I didn't care for the Pinot noir by the glass but the Bordeaux was nice. I'd definitely return.

came here for lunch on a Wednesday. cute and intimate small French restaurant. Had affordable entrees and a pleasant ambiance in a quiet neighborhood!
No comment

Been coming here for years and amazingly this place has gotten even better and more fun. The music on Sunday nights is excellent and the DJ on the weekends after the dinner period is over is fantastic. Easily one of my favorite places In NYC.... WOW! This might be some of the best food in NYC. Super cute spot. Feels like it's actually in a hidden French neighborhood with genuine French food. The boeuf carrot might be one of best pieces of meat I've ever had. Great personable staff. This place is special.

We were in NYC visiting our son and asked him to pick a venue to have dinner Friday night. I could have not been more pleased with his selection. Les Enfants is an extremely cozy, little restaurant with incredible food! I emphasize that, as I am quite particular in what I like to eat. We had oysters, slow braised beef, duck and mussels plus a salad. The food was all totally superb, as well as the service, and we will definitely plan on returning there on our next trip to NYC. It truly is a hidden gem:) We recommend it highly!!!
No comment
No comment

Small and cozy atmosphere makes this lower Manhattan restaurant a "to-go-place", when everywhere else are fully booked on one of those weekend nights. What's unexpected was the food quality. We were a large group, so everyone ordered different food and we pretty much got to taste everything on our table. (The beauty of casual dining!) I would hate to see this place getting too popular and hard to get seated, but they definitely deserve to be highly rated. The wait staffs, happened to be a good friend of someone at our table, we're so amazing and pleasant. I would love to come back whenever I'm in the area.
No comment
The boeuf was truly special here as the meat was so tender that it seemed to fall apart as I chewed it.  Definitely would go back just for that dish.

A really nice, little French restaurant in LES. The ambiance is very mellow and low key, and I love the exposed brick and super French mural drawing on the walls. The dinner menu is not very expansive, but they have very good options for all of your favorite French staples. I got the duck confit and it was amazing. It was served with white beans, dark greens, a puree of some sort, and a delicious, slightly sweet sauce. I definitely want to come back to get the duck again (hopefully they will serve the duck breast that night,) as well as to try the camembert and mussels.

I love the laidback vibe and food on this place. I think it is very hard in this city to create a place which has a genuine non pretentious vibe. Usually it is artificial.  This place is not.  I think you can go for a special event or to just have a delicious meal. It will work for both
No comment
Loved the service and the food was really good. I ordered the avocado eggs Benedict with chorizo. Delicious. A plus was the mimosas. If they were endless this would have been paradise.

I LOVE this place! The food is always excellent and the menu changes regularly. Farm to table, fresh, organic. The cocktails are also delicious and seasonal. And on top of that it's a community. You'll always run into interesting people you might have already met there. Can't say enough good things about Les Enfants!

I ate here almost every Monday for an entire year. Never thought I'd work in Chinatown for 12 months and primarily eat French food. But that's what happened after I stumbled upon Les Enfants. A cute restaurant with friendly service and fantastic food. They also have a great lunch special for $11 - choose two items from their salads, soups and tartines (half soup/salad kind of thing). I never ordered something I regretted. The kale salad is outstanding, as is the goat cheese salad. I also loved the savory buckwheat crepes. Just come in, come often, and try everything on the menu!

We were looking for a brunch spot in the area and saw this place on yelp. Decided to give it a try. Couldn't be more pleased. The staff was super friendly and attentive (at one point they dropped my toast on the ground, they responded by bringing me 4 pieces of toast) and the food was delicious. We had the French toast, croque madame, eggs and chorizo and country bacon. All were delicious. The place wasn't crowded. Just keep in mind it's cash only. We will be coming back for sure, I think this is our new brunch spot in the area.
Great ice cream review!! Omg taste like a whole bowl of vanilla !! Yum yummy will come back what a great find!!

Omg. Have been here for dinner and always loved it but never for brunch until today. The brunch menu is amazing. The savory crepes made with gluten-free buckwheat flour are amazing. And the brunch menu has something for everyone. Plus great drinks. The outdoor seating is relaxing, away from the hustle and bustle so be sure to hit this place up before the temps start to drop.
No comment

This is one of those very very rare restaurant experiences here or, now unfortunately, in any major city worldwide where the owners actually cook and oversee the restaurant, know every inch of what is going on, a simple set-up on an authentic LES street corner, nothing overdone and/or unnecessary either in its decor or in its menu, where prices are kept low for really exceptional food, a premium on fresh food, great cocktails and wine, good and not servile service (from, I must say, very good-looking staff!). There is nothing more I can want in a restaurant experience. These are real professionals working to please their clientele without pretensions. The love of being restauranteurs shines through. This hardly exists anymore anywhere! The rest of you lot who want a different kind of restaurant experience, you are welcome to find another place and, as reviewer Penny S. wrote, there are plenty of others nearby. It leaves all the more space for us, real aficionados of real restaurants, to enjoy Les Enfants!
No comment
No comment
No comment

After spending a lovely time at Seward Park, my 2-year-old daughter and I had a truly delicious dinner at LES Enfants de Bohème. I can't say enough wonderful things about this little gem on the Lower East side. The staff were extremely accommodating to my little independent eater and the food was exceptional. Lila and I devoured the piquant tomato and cod chowder, indulged in the artichoke dip, and ate every bit of the curried cauliflower and tabouli. The latter was  the highlight of our meal. We want to thank the kind owner and sweet staff for letting my little foodie have a supremely fun time by dancing and eating, and for refilling my glass of rosé. :) #toddlerfoodie #lesenfantsdeboheme

I'm a little hesitant to write this review because I don't want  my little secret to get out-- this little bistro is a local gem that rarely has a wait. The cocktails and food are all outstanding, especially for the price. I recommend going with friends and sharing dishes because everything is so delicious-- make sure you include an order of the moules du jour. The staff was also excellent and made the meal all the more enjoyable. French food may not be what you're looking for so close to China Town, but treat yourself to this one. You won't regret it.
No comment

Lovely hidden takeout cafe w/ a public space to sit in the front in the summers. Great service, French sandwiches, coffee and teas. Reasonably priced. The bacon egg and cheese on a croissant will turn your day around

A friend who lives nearby first brought me to Les Enfants de Bohème about two years ago, and I have made it a point to go out of my way to go there since, with or without company. The food and drink are unfailingly delicious, the people are wonderful, and they have created a warm and vibrant community. It is what a neighborhood bistro should be - welcoming, delicious, unpretentious - like home, but better.
Obsessed with the staff and food- everything is amazing here, feel like you're part of the family!
Amazing Service, cozy spot to come for a date. Highly recommend. East is the "Best"...
We enjoyed a great meal at Les Enfants  last Wednesday, the Camembert roti was a great start, the cod and chicken were even better! Merci Stephan pour votre service! We will be back again soon.
No comment

Great place for Sunday brunch. We had LES Eggs Benedict and Norwegian Eggs Benedict. Both were very very good. We also got the Belgian chocolate mousse which was top notch. It has raspberry compote and mixed berries toppings that complement the wonderful mousse. It's just that they only accept cash but then there's an ATM inside the resto. If you hate paying in cash, this might be an issue. Overall, it's a good experience. The staff - possibly one of the owners was also pretty hands on and very personable. Will definitely come back!

One of the best places I've been on the Lower East Side. We ordered the gratin artichoke and a steak with carrots with whipped potatoes, and everything exceeded our expectactions. The beef came with a mustard-y sauce on the side: it's hard to describe how good it was. The cocktails were great too--recommend the Two Bridges. On top of everything, the service was amazing. (Marion, the waitress was super friendly!)

This place was the best food I ever had in the lower east side. The atmosphere is very proper. The service was amazing and the staff is so friendly. Every staff member I had contact with was very knowledgeable about the location and the menu. The surroundings are very nice. The wait was a very short time. The place was clean and well taken care of. The drink selection was the best mixed drinks ever. The food was easily top notch. I would easily recommend this place to anyone ever.
No comment
Great brunch spot! Food is amazing! I had Egg Florentine, it was so delicious. It's kinda tucked in a quieter corner of LES, but it's so charming and cozy. I'd go back again. Cash only!!
No comment

Perhaps we did not order the right items, but I thought food here was just okay... I ordered a mushroom and brie savory crepe and there was only toppings in the center and most of the crepe was unflavored. The creme brulee was exceedingly sweet. Even after removing the layer of caramelized sugar and sipping coffee in between, the custard base was overwhelmingly sweet. The space was cute and cozy though.

First time there, ordered two appetizers and two entrees. It was a raining night and it was super humid out. There were only few people at the restaurant. We have to ask the waitress to open the AC for us because we are all sweating... My friends ordered a rose and a lemonade. The lemonade was nothing but tap water with a piece of lemon. No taste at all. We ordered the same thing again thinking the waitress might've gotten us a wrong drink. We also asked what's inside the lemonade, the waitress said it's literally water with lemon and some syrup... at least she is being honest about it. Do not try:( so both of the appetizers we ordered are pretty good ( tartare and egg white bacon toast). Great and friendly service. Food was just pretty good though. I might return if I'm in the neighborhood.

By far my favorite spot for dinner in the lower Eastside. Amazing atmosphere. The food was orgasmic. If I could eat here everyday I would. Most authentic French restaurant in NYC !

I live in San Francisco, a town with great restaurants, and I always make a point to come to Les Enfants des Boheme for a meal that is beautifully crafted in a space that is intimate and dreamy.

This is our go to restaurant in the neighborhood.  Love the mussels for dinner, and have had brunch several times.  Chicken wonderful as well.  Lovely staff.

Get thee to this little secret nugget of a restaurant before the plebs catch on! Went here for birthday/date night with my boo and had a truly wonderful dining experience. I had my birthday here last night with about 12 people. The food was exceptional, the service was outstanding, and the restaurant is full of family warmth and utter professionalism. Food was good, however, the lady seem to be too busy staring at the computer screen rather than giving us the dessert menu we asked for, so after watching her walk around and chatting with other staff for a while, we just got the check from another waitress and left. oh well, less money spent for us.
Really excellent meal. I highly recommend the cheese plate, and the boeuf carottes was insanely good!

Hidden gem in Two Bridges.  Must eat in neighborhood.

local vibes. great service and food. very fair prices. cocktails are bomb. under the radar and away from the hype. cool bar to go solo or on a date or during the week or whenever.
Excellent food and very friendly staff, always my top choice when I'm in the area. All of the food is fresh and the presentation is always very good.

Perfect neighborhood French place. Great owner and family as well as waitress. The food has been very good for the price point. Wine is good though not exactly a steal. For good neighborhood style French food it's definitely the place to go.

I really like this restaurant. Drinks are good, service, food is delicious. I enjoyed everything we ordered. The mussels, duck, braised beef, salmon, french dip.... its a must try. I was able to get reservations for a large group, that night was perfect!

The good is always good. Prices are reasonable, they have a corner with toys for kids which is a sweet touch.  Service is good. The decor is very conducive to a relaxing atmosphere. The cocktails are pretty on point most times.

Excellent choice for a birthday dinner! Our party of six celebrated a birthday here last week and we enjoyed some great classic French nomz. We also had the lamb shank, steak, mussels and salmon. I had a bite of everything else and it was done well! Into desserts...they only had a chocolate cake and a creme Brulee which in my opinion was a bit weak but I I will come back again to try the other desserts. Mais oui we shall be back!!!!

This place is hidden on the corner of the street. It's a tiny place with an amazing menu of food. I came here on a Thursday with some friends and co-workers. It was really delicious and a dessert I would recommend. I had a taste of the apple tarte and it was really good as well. I didn't get to try the belgian chocolate. All in all I am looking forward to a second visit when I am in the area.  One Caveat, when I was there it was cash only, so bring some money.
Lovely! Cozy and sweet. The service was terrific. Had the croque madam with a salad. Perfect.

We had a 1.5 hours wait because the tour boat we were taking was at capacity 3 people in front of us....frustrating BUT Sabrina was our life saver!!! A round of spicy Gringos for the ATX girls hit the spot!!!! Highly recommend! Drinks are great & the food is phenomenal.

It's unbelievable how delicious this food is! We ordered a cheese plate, duck confit, and chocolate mousse. Each dish was more exquisite than the one before. They know what they're doing in that kitchen. I highly recommend! The service was also outstanding.
Neighborhood gem. This place is a warm and friendly French restaurant tucked away in the lower east side. The food is great and the staff is awesome. But thumbs up.

Such a beautiful location tasty breakfast nice drinks and when we were here today (Sunday) a live guitarist was playing, no shredding solos just a lilting sparkle of music in the air. The kind of place you hope to come in to from a cold day. So happy they opened here!

Wonderful restaurant - soothing ambience, dark and cozy, and fantastic food.  This restaurant shows how it's done!

Also, the parklet the owners built outside is further testament to their local love in its inviting of public use. LES Enfants makes me feel both totally at home and like I'm in every favorite spot from my travels, all at once. Magic.
Best brunch I ever had in a long while. The service is great and the interior design brings the feel of the uniqueness around the neighborhood. Definitely a place to come for any occasion.

Got the creme brûlée for desert, perfect caramelized top- creamy and set custard. So why four stars? The place is cash only- but a main dish here runs for at least $20 a pop, meaning that unless you carry a decent amount of cash around with you, you are probably going to have to use their atm which surprise surprise will charge you a fee. It's 2019, if a restaurant is charging more than $12 for a dish I'm going to be annoyed that it's cash only. Hopefully this will be something they will reconsider in the future.

Was overall a bit disappointed by this place. I'll start with the pros. The fried shrimp and vegetable dumplings were incredible! Maybe the best dumplings I've had in the city. What makes these dumplings so unique are the skins. They're lightly pan fried so that they're crisp, yet still chewy and almost a little bouncy and not at all greasy. We also got cucumber with beef tendon which was good. The flavors were a good mix of vinegar, soy sauce, and Szechuan spiciness, although I think I would've liked more of each of those flavors. It was a bit overpriced ($16), which I would expect from a nicer place. I actually found the ambiance of the place rather charming; it's definitely a hole in the wall place and when I walked in, there was an older man hand making dumplings. They were also very creative with their outdoor seating, they essentially built these tiny outdoor wooden shacks. Now for the cons. The 2 noodle soups we got (mixed beef noodle soup and roast duck noodle soup) were sorely lacking in flavor. The broth taste rather bland and I truly can't even name any flavors it had. This is such a letdown because I feel like broth is the most important component of Asian noodle soups. The meats were good. Unfortunately they didn't ask us what kind of noodles we wanted and just brought us rice noodles, so we weren't able to try the knife cut noodles. I'm surprised this place gets so much attention for the noodles, maybe I should've tried the pan fried noodles instead.
